comments:
1. In the project properties dialog, create an external tool builder on a project. Click OK.
2. Delete the launch configuration manually from the navigator.
3. Try to open the project properties dialog. The following exception occurs:

I cannot reproduce this problem Joe.
I get no exceptions and an error dialog indicating the missing launch config.
I don't see how removing .launch files could result in a widget is diposed 
error anyway? 
Can you see if this is just a MAC phenomenon?

The stack trace baffles me. If you follow it from the bottom up, it looks like
during the page initialization we tried to open the error dialog (expected)
but opening the error dialog somehow got back into initializing the page, which
got *back* into the error dialog and then back into the page... All in one
stack trace? I don't understand. Could it be that the Mac didn't open the
error dialog on top and make it modal, allowing you to click in the property
page?

Doesn't happen on Linux or Win32. Somehow it looks like the Window code is
really getting into the circular path shown in the stack trace.
Andre, can you please take a look at this problem and advise?
Veronika, can you please take a look at this problem? Thanks.

The problem only appears on Mac. Works fine on Windows and Linux-GTK
(20030312)(an error dialog is displayed).

Moving to Platform/SWT.

I cannot reproduce this in the latest. I believe this is the same problem as Bug#34166 .
I will close this bug. Please reopen it if you can reproduce it in builds > 20030317.
